operators"},"addReward(uint256)":{"notice":"This function can be called to add rewards to the pool"},"canAlert(address)":{"notice":"This function checks to see whether the alerter may raise an alert to claim rewards"},"changeRewardRate(uint256)":{"notice":"This function can be called to change the reward rate for the pool. This change only affects future rewards, i.e. rewards earned at a previous rate are unaffected."},"conclude()":{"notice":"Closes the pool, unreserving future staker rewards, expires the reward and releases unreserved rewards"},"emergencyPause()":{"notice":"This function pauses staking"},"emergencyUnpause()":{"notice":"This function unpauses staking"},"getDelegatesCount()":{"notice":"Delegates count increases after an operator is added to the list of operators and stakes the minimum required amount."},"getMigrationTarget()":{"notice":"This function returns the migration target contract address"},"getTotalDelegatedAmount()":{"notice":"Total delegated amount is calculated by dividing the total community staker staked amount by the delegation rate, i.e. totalDelegatedAmount = pool.totalCommunityStakedAmount / delegationRateDenominator"},"hasAccess(address,bytes32[])":{"notice":"Validates if a community staker has access to the private staking pool"},"isActive()":{"notice":"The staking pool starts closed and only allows stakers to stake once it's opened"},"isOperator(address)":{"notice":"Returns true if an address is an operator"},"isPaused()":{"notice":"This function returns the pause state"},"migrate(bytes)":{"notice":"This function allows stakers to migrate funds to a new staking pool."},"onTokenTransfer(address,uint256,bytes)":{"notice":"Called when LINK is sent to the contract via `transferAndCall`"},"owner()":{"notice":"Get the current owner"},"proposeMigrationTarget(address)":{"notice":"This function allows the contract owner to set a proposed migration target address. If the migration target is valid it renounces the previously accepted migration target (if any)."},"raiseAlert()":{"notice":"This function creates an alert for a stalled feed"},"removeOperators(address[])":{"notice":"Removes one or more operators from a list of operators. When an operator is removed, we store their principal in a separate mapping to prevent immediate withdrawals. This is so that the removed operator can only unstake at the same time as every other staker."},"setFeedOperators(address[])":{"notice":"Allows the contract owner to set the list of on-feed operator addresses who are subject to slashing"},"setMerkleRoot(bytes32)":{"notice":"This function is called to update the staking allowlist in a private staking pool"},"setPoolConfig(uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Set the pool config"},"start(uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Transfers LINK tokens and initializes the reward"},"transferOwnership(address)":{"notice":"Allows an owner to begin transferring ownership to a new address, pending."},"unstake()":{"notice":"This function allows stakers to exit the pool after it has been concluded. It returns the principal as well as base and delegation rewards."},"withdrawRemovedStake()":{"notice":"This function allows removed operators to withdraw their original principal. Operators can only withdraw after the pool is closed, like every other staker."},"withdrawUnusedReward()":{"notice":"This function can be called to withdraw unused reward amount from the staking pool. It can be called before the pool is initialized, after the pool is concluded or when the reward expires."}},"version":1}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"contracts/Staking.sol":"Staking"},"evmVersion":"london","libraries":{},"metadata":{"bytecodeHash":"none"},"optimizer":{"enabled":true,"runs":75000},"remappings":[":@chainlink/=node_modules/@chainlink/",":@openzeppelin/=node_modules/@openzeppelin/",":ds-test/=lib/forge-std/lib/ds-test/src/",":forge-std/=lib/forge-std/src/",":hardhat-deploy/=node_modules/hardhat-deploy/",":hardhat/=node_modules/hardhat/",":prettier-plugin-solidity/=node_modules/prettier-plugin-solidity/"],"viaIR":true},"sources":{"contracts/RewardLib.sol":{"keccak256":"0x0cea4a3c95d8edd81fb252f5954abfea269668e0f29c84f4deff9a731cb188f0","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://f3a359375c3dd89880ca0baa61b1fdb5703e0737644a23a38748ed526e1f64e3","dweb:/ipfs/QmbvHvy4egZZ9RTLwGT83iyXmMjX3sEDDddiZZ8PmPsHrw"]},"contracts/SafeCast.sol":{"keccak256":"0xa7ef215c91c68b867b4c9cb03dd04b96040cb0cec13824af5a476e64ddc8f2ab","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://7d52297205bf759d08b0d202c95517bf85205a3f31fde8b0500514bccc351923","dweb:/ipfs/QmUTFbdtiLPhqLQCZyrgdMJsE1i1cyzb6GwrCULMKTq9f2"]},"contracts/Staking.sol":{"keccak256":"0x6ebaff56d1d5e223f44e86d7c5e2a37e769aab447fa6163a5fe24fb20f76eed5","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://cca530408e90ab61e9b3ada08e4b4b8d091b384108e2223aaa4d328a8c972c11","dweb:/ipfs/QmcU7dDAwDrNFj76THiPhF5zjAD6VmAXa7YBm1oE7nAFF6"]},"contracts/StakingPoolLib.sol":{"keccak256":"0xceced04a8de1fb59e2951954b70e644655457322e9613b587d9347f17f67b964","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://3ce36db7a0d3840173fab020120627eac8f7d854db87bd653224aa45a0029900","dweb:/ipfs/QmbbpALJmNo1MgCWT82BQ7gG9Swn7Bgbqj1b7eNk8wipbS"]},"contracts/interfaces/IAlertsController.sol":{"keccak256":"0xafe620ad0a43a624d757622fa21b7bbb813e97e9da797de4caa6fa268f7c5715","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://0476d9db14da3a9a56391d4011ec86f1c088945bb18cb75dd75c4ccdf660002b","dweb:/ipfs/QmdZsV5xwD91ZQjqxxstTVkRS3c5tjwrzRz4t9ze4xR5MK"]},"contracts/interfaces/IMerkleAccessController.sol":{"keccak256": addOperators(address[]).details: Required conditions for adding operators: - Operators can only be added to the pool if they have no prior stake. - Operators can only be readded to the pool if they have no removed stake. - Operators cannot be added to the pool after staking ends (either through conclusion or through reward expiry).

params.operators: A list of operator addresses to add

addReward(uint256).details: Should only be callable by the owner

params.amount: The amount of rewards to add to the pool

changeRewardRate(uint256).details: Should only be callable by the owner. The rate can be increased or decreased. The new rate cannot be 0.

emergencyPause().details: Sets the pause flag to true

emergencyUnpause().details: Sets the pause flag to false

getAvailableReward().details: This reflects how many rewards were made available over the lifetime of the staking pool. This is not updated when the rewards are unstaked or migrated by the stakers. This means that the contract balance will dip below available amount when the reward expires and users start moving their rewards.

returns._0: uint256 total amount of LINK tokens made available for rewards in Juels
uint256 amount of base rewards earned by a staker in Juels
address LINK token contract's address that is used by the pool
uint256 minimum amount that can be staked by a community staker
returns._1: uint256 maximum amount that can be staked by a community staker

returns._0: uint256 number of staking operators that are eligible for delegation rewards
uint256 current delegation rate
uint256 amount of delegation rewards earned by an operator in Juels
uint256 total amount of base rewards earned by all stakers in Juels
uint256 total amount of delegated rewards earned by all node operators in Juels
List of the ETH-USD feed node operators' staking addresses
uint256 current maximum staking pool size
The current root of the Staking allowlist merkle tree
address The address of the feed being monitored to raise alerts for
uint256 minimum amount that can be staked by an operator
returns._1: uint256 maximum amount that can be staked by an operator

returns._0: uint256 current reward rate, expressed in juels per second per micro LINK
uint256 reward initialization timestamp
uint256 staker's staked principal amount
uint256 total amount staked by community stakers in Juels
uint256 staked amount that is used when calculating delegation rewards in Juels

getTotalRemovedAmount().details: Used to make sure that contract's balance is correct. total staked amount + total removed amount + available rewards = current balance

returns._0: uint256 the sum of removed operator principals that have not been withdrawn from the staking pool in Juels.
uint256 total amount staked by community stakers and operators in Juels

params.proof: Merkle proof for the community staker's allowlist

returns._0: bool pool status
bool whether or not the pool is paused

params.amount: Amount of LINK sent (specified in wei)
params.data: Optional payload containing a Staking Allowlist Merkle proof

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

params.migrationTarget: Contract address to migrate stakes to.

removeOperators(address[]).details: Should only be callable by the owner when the pool is open. When an operator is removed they can stake as a community staker. We allow that because the alternative (checking for removed stake before staking) is going to unnecessarily increase gas costs in 99.99% of the cases.

params.operators: A list of operator addresses to remove

setFeedOperators(address[]).details: Existing feed operators are cleared before setting the new operators.

params.operators: New list of on-feed operator staker addresses

setMerkleRoot(bytes32).details: Only callable by the contract owner

params.newMerkleRoot: Merkle Tree root, used to prove access for community stakers will be required at start but can be removed at any time by the owner when staking access will be granted to the public.

params.maxCommunityStakeAmount: The max amount of LINK a community staker can stake
params.maxOperatorStakeAmount: The max amount of LINK a Node Op can stake
params.maxPoolSize: The max amount of staked LINK allowed in the pool

params.initialRewardRate: The amount of LINK earned per second for each LINK staked.

withdrawUnusedReward().details: Should only be callable by the owner when the pool is closed

acceptMigrationTarget().notice: This function allows the contract owner to accept a proposed migration target address after a waiting period.

acceptOwnership().notice: Allows an ownership transfer to be completed by the recipient.

addOperators(address[]).notice: Adds one or more operators to a list of operators

addReward(uint256).notice: This function can be called to add rewards to the pool

canAlert(address).notice: This function checks to see whether the alerter may raise an alert to claim rewards

changeRewardRate(uint256).notice: This function can be called to change the reward rate for the pool. This change only affects future rewards, i.e. rewards earned at a previous rate are unaffected.

conclude().notice: Closes the pool, unreserving future staker rewards, expires the reward and releases unreserved rewards

getDelegatesCount().notice: Delegates count increases after an operator is added to the list of operators and stakes the minimum required amount.

getMigrationTarget().notice: This function returns the migration target contract address

getTotalDelegatedAmount().notice: Total delegated amount is calculated by dividing the total community staker staked amount by the delegation rate, i.e. totalDelegatedAmount = pool.totalCommunityStakedAmount / delegationRateDenominator

hasAccess(address,bytes32[]).notice: Validates if a community staker has access to the private staking pool

isActive().notice: The staking pool starts closed and only allows stakers to stake once it's opened

isOperator(address).notice: Returns true if an address is an operator

isPaused().notice: This function returns the pause state

migrate(bytes).notice: This function allows stakers to migrate funds to a new staking pool.

onTokenTransfer(address,uint256,bytes).notice: Called when LINK is sent to the contract via `transferAndCall`

proposeMigrationTarget(address).notice: This function allows the contract owner to set a proposed migration target address. If the migration target is valid it renounces the previously accepted migration target (if any).

raiseAlert().notice: This function creates an alert for a stalled feed

removeOperators(address[]).notice: Removes one or more operators from a list of operators. When an operator is removed, we store their principal in a separate mapping to prevent immediate withdrawals. This is so that the removed operator can only unstake at the same time as every other staker.

setFeedOperators(address[]).notice: Allows the contract owner to set the list of on-feed operator addresses who are subject to slashing

setMerkleRoot(bytes32).notice: This function is called to update the staking allowlist in a private staking pool

start(uint256,uint256).notice: Transfers LINK tokens and initializes the reward

transferOwnership(address).notice: Allows an owner to begin transferring ownership to a new address, pending.

unstake().notice: This function allows stakers to exit the pool after it has been concluded. It returns the principal as well as base and delegation rewards.

withdrawRemovedStake().notice: This function allows removed operators to withdraw their original principal. Operators can only withdraw after the pool is closed, like every other staker.

withdrawUnusedReward().notice: This function can be called to withdraw unused reward amount from the staking pool. It can be called before the pool is initialized, after the pool is concluded or when the reward expires.

@notice The amount to divide an alerter's stake amount when
 calculating their reward for raising an alert.
@notice The ETH USD feed that alerters can raise alerts for.
@notice The proposed address stakers will migrate funds to
@notice The timestamp of when the migration target was proposed at
@notice The address stakers can migrate their funds to
@notice The round ID of the last feed round an alert was raised

@notice The merkle root of the merkle tree generated from the list
 of staker addresses with early acccess.

@notice The number of seconds until the feed is considered stale
 and the priority period begins.

@notice The number of seconds until the priority period ends
 and the regular period begins.

@notice The amount of LINK to reward an operator who
 raises an alert in the priority period.
@notice The minimum stake amount that a node operator can stake
@notice The minimum stake amount that a community staker can stake

@notice The minimum number of node operators required to initialize the
 staking pool.

@notice The minimum reward duration after pool config updates and pool
 reward extensions
@notice The duration of earned rewards to slash when an alert is raised

@notice Used to calculate delegated stake amount
 = amount / delegation rate denominator = 100% / 100 = 1%
